etymologies: late 16th century: from Latin sinus ‘curve’, used in medieval Latin as a translation of Arabic jayb ‘pocket, sine’

definitions: the trigonometric function that is equal to the ratio of the side opposite a given angle (in a right triangle) to the hypotenuse.
shortDefinitions: trigonometric function that is equal to ratio of side opposite given angle in right-angled triangle to hypotenuse
